bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the original.

div1.p:
Henry Hight
vs
Ann, a black woman

And the said defendant by Edward Hempstead his attorney comes and defends the force & injury when where &C saith he is not guilty in manner and form as the said Anne, be her complaint &C hath alledged and of this he puts himself in the County for trial

And the Plaintiff also
McGirk & Tompkins atties for Plaintiff

and the said defendant in for the plea in this trial, the said defendant, further defends the force & injury when where &C and saith that the plaintiff of having and maintaining her said as his thereof against him ought to be bound and : because he says that here to for to wit at the County of Saint Charles aforesaid on the first day of January, one thousand, eight hundred, and Twelve. The said Ann was then there in the possession of and lawfully owned as a slave for life by one James Rein; and being to wit owned and possessed the said James Rein afterwards to wit then that said Haight and after his death To wit then & there letters of administraton on his estate now in the force of Law granted to the said Henry Hight, under the hand and Seal of the Clerk of the Court of Common Pleas for the said County of Saint Chalres where said letters of administration on herewith and which said letter of administration are still in full force unmatched and and by on her of said letters of administration, and the laws of this terriotry in which case made and provided, the
said Henry Hight an administrator an aforesaid &C, then and there taken the said Ann into his possession as the slave of the said James Rein deemed, and his the said Ann, &C detain as such as by law he had a right to &C at the time & place of the trespass assault and battery and false imprisonment complaining of and which is the same trespass assault & battery and false imprisonment complained of and to other, without that the said Henry did then with force and arms and against The Peace assault, beat, heat, wound, and illy treat and imprison and detain the said Ann as the said declaration supposes without any just cause in lawful authority all which he is ready to verify & prove. Therefore he prays judgement the said Anne may be laws and precluded of having and maintaining her said action against him, and he allowing his costs

and in further plea in this behalf the said defendant further defends the force & injury when where &C and claims that the said Ann of having and maintaining her said action him of against him ought to be bound &precluded became the days that heretofore to wit at the County aforesaid, on the first day of January, in the year one thousand eight hundred and Twelve, the said Ann a black woman aforesaid was the servant of one man James Rein, and his assigns for the time and space of Twenty Four
and and the said James Rein afterwards to wit then there &C and this after to wit then & there letters of administration is &C force of law was granted under the hand and Seal of the clerk of the Court of Common Pleas for said County of Saint Charles on the estate of the said James Rein deceased to said Henry Hight on by said letter of administration how there &C the Anne appear, and which said letter of administration and still in full force, unmatched and unrepeated, and by thereof the said Henry Hight an administrator as aforesaid &C this there take into his possession as the servant of said James Rein and his assigns the said Ann, a black woman, in by law he had a right to do at the time and place of the trespasses complained of and which in the same trespass assault battery, wounding imprisonment, and by the said Ann complained of and &C other without that, that the said Henry &C then there with force and arms against the peace assault, beat, wound imprison, and detain the said Ann without any just right a lawful authority on the said Ann hath above complaining, all which the said Henry is ready to verify. Therefore he prays judgement of the said Ann, her action aforesaid against him shall have a maintain, and that he be allowed his costs

Henry Hight
vs.
Ann. a black woman

Filed 29 th October 1816
WM Christy Jr. Clerk
